author: Aisha Al-Muslim
title: Roche to Acquire Healthcare-Software Company Flatiron for $1.9 Billion
text:
Pharmaceuticals firm Roche Holding AG has agreed to buy the shares it doesnâ€™t already own of Flatiron Health Inc., an oncology software company, for $1.9 billion, the companies said Thursday.
Switzerland-based Roche said the deal is part of an effort to accelerate its development and delivery of medicines for cancer patients. Roche already owns 12.6% of New York City-based Flatiron Health, which was launched in 2012.
